abstract.p: An apparatus and methods for a card that allows a cardholder to set up auto-charge payment of dues and fees to a series of clubs, merchants or service providers. The card also may be used for other transactions that accept credit cards. The apparatus includes a database containing information of the associated clubs, merchants and service providers, so that applicants and cardholders can easily configure auto-charging for multiple business concerns in one sitting. The apparatus may process auto-charge transactions in an automated fashion without requiring a cardholder to submit payment authorization or the business concern to submit a charge for each payment. Inconvenience and administrative costs to the cardholder and the business concern are reduced. The system and method provide a competitive advantage to the associated business concerns to secure the initial account and then to maintain it. The system and method encourages card loyalty of both the card members and the business concerns to the card provider.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Credit instrument and system with automated payment of club, merchant and service provider fees
Credit instrument and system with automated payment of club, merchant, and service provider fees

The apparatus may process auto-charge transactions in an automated fashion without requiring a cardholder to submit payment authorization or the business concern to submit a charge for each payment. Inconvenience and administrative costs to the cardholder and the business concern are reduced.

The system and method provide a competitive advantage to the associated business concerns to secure the initial account and then to maintain it. The system and method encourages card loyalty of both the card members and the business concerns to the card provider.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: System and Method for Card Processing with Automated Payment of Club, Merchant, and Service Provider Fees

abstract.p: An apparatus and methods for a card that allows a cardholder to set up auto-charge payment of dues and fees to a series of clubs, merchants or service providers. The card also may be used for other transactions that accept credit cards. The apparatus includes a database containing information of the associated clubs, merchants and service providers, so that applicants and cardholders can easily configure auto-charging for multiple business concerns in one sitting. The apparatus may process auto-charge transactions in an automated fashion without requiring a cardholder to submit payment authorization or the business concern to submit a charge for each payment. Inconvenience and administrative costs to the cardholder and the business concern are reduced.

The system and method provide a competitive advantage to the associated business concerns to secure the initial account and then to maintain it. The system and method encourages card loyalty of both the card members and the business concerns to the card provider.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: Credit instrument and system providing multiple services including access to credit services and access to a service provider club

abstract.p: An apparatus and methods for a card that allows a cardholder to set up auto-charge payment of dues and fees to a series of clubs, merchants or service providers. The card also may be used for other transactions that accept credit cards. The apparatus includes a database containing information of the associated clubs, merchants and service providers, so that applicants and cardholders can easily configure auto-charging for multiple business concerns in one sitting. The apparatus may process auto-charge transactions in an automated fashion without requiring a cardholder to submit payment authorization or the business concern to submit a charge for each payment. Inconvenience and administrative costs to the cardholder and the business concern are reduced. The system and method provide a competitive advantage to the associated business concerns to secure the initial account and then to maintain it. The system and method encourages card loyalty of both the card members and the business concerns to the card provider.

bibliographic-data.invention-title: CREDIT INSTRUMENT AND SYSTEM WITH AUTOMATED PAYMENT OF CLUB, MERCHANT AND SERVICE PROVIDER FEES
SYSTEME ET INSTRUMENT DE CREDIT PERMETTANT UN PAIEMENT AUTOMATISE DE COTISATIONS DE CLUBS, DE COMMISSIONS DE COMMERCE ET DE REDEVANCES A DES FOURNISSEURS DE SERVICES

abstract.p: An apparatus and methods for a card that allows a cardholder to set up auto-charge payment of dues and fees to a series of clubs, merchants or service providers. The card also may be used for other transactions that accept credit cards. The apparatus includes a database (110) containing information of the associated clubs, merchants and service providers, so that applicants (105) and cardholders (105) can easily configure auto-charging for multiple business concerns in one sitting. The apparatus may process auto-charge transactions in an automated fashion without requiring a cardholder (105) to submit payment authorization or the business concern to submit a charge for each payment. Inconvenience and administrative costs to the cardholder and the business concern are reduced. The system and method encourages card loyalty of both the card members and the business concerns to the card provider.

L'invention se rapporte un appareil et à des procédés associés à une carte qui permet à son détenteur d'effectuer le paiement automatique de droits et de redevances à des clubs, commerçants ou fournisseurs de service. Cette carte peut également être utilisée pour d'autres transactions qui peuvent se faire par cartes de crédit. Ledit appareil comporte une base de données (110) contenant des informations relatives aux clubs, commerçants et fournisseurs de services associés, et permettant aux demandeurs (105) et détenteurs de cartes (105) de facilement configurer un paiement automatique pour de multiples entreprises commerciales en une seule fois.

L'appareil peut traiter de manière automatisée des transactions à paiement automatique sans qu'il soit nécessaire au détenteur de carte (105) de soumettre une autorisation de paiement ou à l'entreprise commerciale de payer une redevance pour chaque paiement. Ce système permet ainsi de réduire les inconvénients et les coûts administratifs encourus par le détenteur de carte et l'entreprise commerciale. Ce système et ce procédé encouragent par ailleurs la fidélité au fournisseur de carte à la fois des détenteurs de cartes et des entreprises commerciales.
